data.title: TRU Voices Play Series
data.text:
THE 2015 TRU VOICES NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

17th annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers,

followed by our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing

featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers.

Reservations required: 212-714-7628, or email us at TRUStaff1@gmail.com

All performances will be at 7pm.

15 Vandam St., New York, NY 10013

MONDAY JUNE 15TH

directed by Brent Buell

with Onyi Okoli, Tyson Hall, Nina Yvette Coleman,

Erick Carter, Torre Reigns, Jada Castillo, Alisha Espinosa

"Dollars and Sense Panel": David Elliott, co-director of Perry Street Theatricals (Dames at Sea, My Life Is a Musical, Bedlam Theatre's St. Joan/Hamlet, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, In the Continuum, An Oak Tree); RK Greene, marketing director for The Directors Company, producer (A Time to Kill, Rocket to the Moon, Peter & the Starcatcher, Room Service, Love Child, Cougar the musical); Patricia Klausner, producer (Pippin, Scottsboro Boys, Stick Fly, Trip to Bountiful), managing director Shotgun Productions/Global Arts Initiative; Martin Platt, co-director of Perry Street Theatricals (Dames at Sea, My Life Is a Musical, Bedlam Theatre's St. Joan/Hamlet, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, In the Continuum, An Oak Tree); Daryl Sledge, Mothers Boy LLC (Fried Chicken and Latkes).

MONDAY JUNE 22ND

directed by Eric Tucker

"Dollars and Sense Panel": Georgia Buchanan, managing director of York Theatre Company, formerly with Folksbiene Theatre and NJ Shakespeare, producer (Kat and the Kings, Springhill Singing Disaster, Communicating Doors); David Elliott, co-director of Perry Street Theatricals (Dames at Sea, My Life Is a Musical, Bedlam Theatre's St. Joan/Hamlet, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, In the Continuum, An Oak Tree); RK Greene, marketing director for The Directors Company, producer (A Time to Kill, Rocket to the Moon, Peter & the Starcatcher, Room Service, Love Child, Cougar the musical); Jeremy Handelman, producer (On the Town, White's Lies, F#@king Up Everything); Martin Platt, co-director of Perry Street Theatricals (Dames at Sea, My Life Is a Musical, Bedlam Theatre's St. Joan/Hamlet, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, In the Continuum, An Oak Tree).

MONDAY JUNE 29TH

directed by Melissa Maxwell

with Patricia Randell, Melissa Hurst, Mark Finley,

Les J. N. Mau, Brad Bellamy, Lawrence Cantor

"Dollars and Sense Panel": Pat Addiss (Gigi, A Christmas Story, Dinner with the Boys, Buyer and Cellar, Promises Promises, Little Women); Michael Alden, producer (Disgraced, Becoming Dr. Ruth, Grey Gardens, The King's Speech on stage, Bat Boy); David Elliott, co-director of Perry Street Theatricals (Dames at Sea, My Life Is a Musical, Bedlam Theatre's St. Joan/Hamlet, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, In the Continuum, An Oak Tree); Jeremy Handelman, producer (On the Town, White's Lies, F#@king Up Everything).

PREVIOUS SERIES

THE 2014 TRU VOICES NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

16th annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers, followed by reception and our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers.

Reservations required: 212/714-7628, or email us at TRUStaff1@gmail.com

All performances will be at 7pm.

Engelman Recital Hall

55 Lexington Avenue (entrance on 25th Street)

MONDAY JUNE 9TH

"Dollars and Sense Panel": Patrick Blake, producer (Bedlam Theater’s Hamlet/St. Joan, The Exonerated, In the Continuum, Play Dead); Jeremy Handelman, producer (White's Lies, F#@king Up Everything); Angie Kristic, artistic director/producer of KBO Productions.

MONDAY JUNE 16TH

"Dollars and Sense Panel": Patrick Blake, producer (Bedlam Theater’s Hamlet/St. Joan, The Exonerated, In the Continuum, Play Dead); Neil Danoff, investor, producer (Bridges of Madison County, All The Way, Lucky Guy, Matilda, Glengarry Glen Ross revival, Evita revival, The Addams Family, Spring Awakening); David Elliott, co-director of Perry Street Theatricals (Bedlam Theatre's St. Joan/Hamlet, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, In the Continuum, An Oak Tree); Sharon Fallon, general manager, producer (Beautiful, Lysistrata Jones, I’m Not Rappaport); Elysabeth Kleinhans, artistic director of 59e59, Animated Theaterworks.

MONDAY JUNE 23RD

"Dollars and Sense Panel": Patrick Blake, producer (Bedlam Theater’s Hamlet/St. Joan, The Exonerated, In the Continuum, Play Dead); Neil Danoff, investor, producer (Bridges of Madison County, All The Way, Lucky Guy, Matilda, Glengarry Glen Ross revival, Evita revival, The Addams Family, Spring Awakening); R.K. Greene, producer (Peter and the Starcatcher, Room Service, Love Child); Cheryl Wiesenfeld, producer (All the Way, Rocky, Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, Porgy & Bess, Play Dead, A Steady Rain, Legally Blonde, Caroline or Change, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, The Exonerated, Elaine Stritch: At Liberty).

PREVIOUS SERIES

THE 2013 TRU VOICES NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

15th annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers, followed by reception and our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers.

MONDAY JUNE 10TH

Associate producer Kimberly Eaton

Directed by Christopher Carter Sanderson

"Dollars and Sense" talkback panel with Neil Danoff, investor/producer (Matilda, Lucky Guy, Spring Awakening, The Addams Family, Merchant of Venice, Evita, Wedding Singer); Carl D. White, Martian Entertainment, Tony Award-winning Producer & General Manager (The Normal Heart, On a Clear Day You Can See Forever, Priscilla Queen of the Desert, Gore Vidal’s The Best Man, I Hope They Serve Beer on Broadway, [title of show], Potted Potter, BARE the musical, Naked Boys Singing!, Altar Boys, Immediate Family). Moderated by Tom Polum, producer (The Toxic Avenger musical, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, All Shook Up).

MONDAY JUNE 17TH

Directed by Linda S Nelson

with Richard Bekins, Jenny Maguire, Julia Silverman,

Matthew Trumbull, Nicola Riske, Andrea Gallo and Nora Hummel

"Dollars and Sense" talkback panel with Patrick Blake, producer (The Exonerated, In the Continuum, Play Dead); Peter Bogyo, general manager (The Trip to Bountiful starring Cicely Tyson, Stick Fly, Time Stands Still, The Blonde in the Thunderbird, Voices in the Dark, A Moon for the Misbegotten w/Kevin Spacey, Sly Fox w/Richard Dreyfus, Fortune’s Fool, Madame Melville, The Unexpected Man); R.K. Greene, producer (Peter and the Starcatcher, Room Service, Love Child); Angie Kristic, Artistic Director/Producer of KBO Productions.; Lorca Peress, artistic director MultiStages; Cheryl Wiesenfeld, producer (Vanya & Sonia & Masha & Spike, Porgy & Bess, Play Dead, A Steady Rain, Legally Blonde, Caroline or Change, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, The Exonerated, Elaine Stritch: At Liberty).

MONDAY JUNE 24TH

Directed by Eric Parness

with Callie Frisell, Charlotte Hampden, Chris Ceraso,

Brad Makarowski, Keelie Sheridan, Mark Peter

"Dollars and Sense" talkback panel with R. Erin Craig, producer/general manager / producer La Vie Productions (Heartbreaker, In the Heights, Fingers and Toes, Stalking the Bogeyman, Academy, Mr. Rickey Calls a Meeting, (Still) Getting My Act Together, High Fidelity, Liberty: A New Musical, The Jazz Age, Love! That 4-Letter Word); Ben Feldman, entertainment attorney (partner at BFGRS, PLLC), producer (Pippin); Patricia Klausner, managing director Shotgun Productions (The Chaos Theories, The Lost Boy), producer (Pippin, The Trip to Bountiful, The Scottsboro Boys, Stick Fly); Marie Reynolds, Kramis Productions, co-vice president Shakespeare on the Sound.

Reservations required: 212/714-7628, or email back to us at TRUStaff1@gmail.com

All performances will be at 7pm. Soho Playhouse, 15 Vandam Street

Series made possible through generous grants from NYC Dept of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council, 9th district Member Inez Dickens and Member Christine Quinn; NY State Council on the Arts; and the Friars National Association Foundation.

THE 2012 TRU VOICES NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

14th annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers, followed by reception and our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers.

The Roy Arias Theatre, 300 W. 43rd Street, 5th floor.

MONDAY JUNE 4TH

directed by David Lee

with Darren Ritchie • Melissa Van der Schyff • Claybourne Elder

Joanna Howard • Rebecca Fisher

"Dollars and Sense" talkback featuring Pat Addiss, producer (Promises, Promises, Little Women, A Christmas Story the musical); Georgia Buchanan, producer/general manager (Communicating Doors, Kat and the Kings) and general manager of Folksbiene National Yiddish Theatre; Neil Danoff, investor/producer (Spring Awakening, The Addams Family, Merchant of Venice, Evita, Wedding Singer); Van Dean of the Broadway Consortium (The Gershwin's Porgy & Bess, Gore Vidal's The Best Man, Evita, Bonnie & Clyde, Ching-lish); Kent Nicholson, Director of Musical Theatre, Literary Associate Playwrights Horizons.

MONDAY JUNE 11TH

directed by Frank Licato

with Sean Patrick Reilly • Mark Byrne • Doug Shearer

"Dollars and Sense" talkback featuring Neil Danoff, investor/producer (Spring Awakening, The Addams Family, Merchant of Venice, Evita, Wedding Singer); Patricia Klausner, producing artistic director Shotgun Productions (The Chaos Theories, The Lost Boy), producer (The Scottsboro Boys, Stick Fly); Tom Polum, producer (The Toxic Avenger, All Shook Up, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels), Ric Wanetik, producer (Marlene, Jolson & Company, Twilight: Los Angeles 1992, television: The Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show).

MONDAY JUNE 18TH

directed by Sue Lawless

with Edna Lee Figueroa • Nichole Donjè • Chiara Montalto • Alexander Stine

"Dollars and Sense" talkback featuring Georgia Buchanan, producer/general manager (Communicating Doors, Kat and the Kings) and general manager of Folksbiene National Yiddish Theatre; Erin Craig, Erin Craig / La Vie Productions LLC, producer / general manager (Liberty A Monumental New Musical, Academy, Psycho Therapy, Jane Austen's Pride & Prejudice, The Sphinx Winx, The Jazz Age); Dani Davis, half pint productions (Little Women, Lonesome West); Pam Koslow, producer (Jelly's Last Jam, Jane Eyre, Yank!); others tba.

?Series made possible through generous grants from NYC Dept of Cultural Affairs in partnership with the City Council, 9th district Member Inez Dickens and Member Christine Quinn; NY State Council on the Arts; and the Friars National Association Foundation.

THE 2011 TRU VOICES

NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

13th annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers, followed by reception and our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers.

Reservations required: 212/714-7628, or email back to us at ChrisM@truonline.org.

All performances will be at 7pm.

The Roy Arias Theatre, 300 W. 43rd Street, 5th floor.

MONDAY JUNE 13TH

starring

JAMES NAUGHTON,

TOVAH FELDSHUH,

PETER JOHNSON

"Dollars and Sense" panel (Left to right): TRU president Bob Ost; Patrick Blake, producer (Play Dead!, The Exonerated, In the Continuum, Noah's Archive, Joe Fearless); Pam Koslow, producer (Jelly's Last Jam, Jane Eyre, Yank!); director Linda Selman; Michael Alden, producer (Grey Gardens the musical, Bridge & Tunnel, Bat Boy; upcoming The King's Speech); Michael Bias, artistic/producing director The Garage Theatre Group; Ricky Stevens, general manager and producer (Radio Golf, Glory Days, A Catered Affair, Empire the musical). Missing from shot: R. Erin Craig, general manager/producer with La Vie Productions (Liberty the musical, The Sphinx Wins, Above Hell's Kitchen, Abraham Lincoln's Big Gay Dance Party).

MONDAY JUNE 20TH

with Peter Reznikoff (Irena's Vow), Stu Richel,

Grant James Varjas, Janet Zarish

"Dollars and Sense" panel featuring Pat Addiss, (Promises, Promises, Passing Strange, Spring Awakening, Little Women, 39 Steps, Housewives of Mannheim); Peter Bogyo, general manager with the Sprecher Organization (A Moon for the Misbegotten w/Kevin Spacey, Sly Fox w/Richard Dreyfus, Fortune’s Fool, Madame Melville, The Unexpected Man, The Joys of Sex); Elliot Fox, managing director Primary Stages; Patricia Klausner, producer (The Scottsboro Boys, Chaos Theories), artistic director of Shotgun Productions; Pam Koslow, producer (Jelly's Last Jam, Jane Eyre, Yank!).

Series made possible with public funds from the New York State Council on the Arts (NYSCA), a stage agency; and from the NYC Department of Culutral Affairs (DCA) and the Friars National Foundation Association.

Series made possible with public funds from the New York State Council on the Arts (NYSCA), a stage agency; and from the NYC Department of Culutral Affairs (DCA) and the Friars National Foundation Association.

THE 2008 TRU VOICES

NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

Tenth annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers, followed by reception and our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers. Reservations required: 212/714-7628. All performances will be at 7pm. The Players Theatre, 115 MacDougal Street, NYC.

OUR "DOLLARS AND SENSE" PANELISTS:

June 2, American Whupass: Pat Addiss (Spring Awakening, 39 Steps, Passing Strange, Bridge & Tunnel, Little Women); Georgia Buchanan, managing director National Yiddish Theatre Folksbiene, formerly with The Women's Project and Shakespeare Theatre of NJ.; Amy Danis of Mars Theatricals (Little Shop of Horrors revival, Swing!, Bug, Cookin', Tabletop); Ken Davenport, producer (Altar Boys, Awesome 80's Prom, Somewhere in Time), general manager (Gypsy, Thoroughly Modern Millie, Jekyll & Hyde); Dani Davis, half pint production (Little Women, Lonesome West); Janet Pailet of P2 Creations (The Grinch Who Stole Christmas, The Great American Trailer Park Musical, Masked).

June 9, Film Chinois: David Black, producer (George M!, A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To The Forum with Phil Silvers, The Aspern Papers, Ready When You Are C.B! with Julie Harris, The Impossible Years); Elysabeth Kleinhans, Animated Theaterworks, 59E59 Theatres; Pam Koslow (Jane Eyre, Jelly's Last Jam, Captain Louie); Tom Smedes, producer (Ace The Musical), formerly of Martian Enetrtainment (Naked Boys Singing, Love Janis); Jack Thomas, producer Bulldog Theatrical (Boublil & Schonberg & Legrand's new musical Marguerite, Almost, Maine, No Way to Treat a Lady, Our Lady of 121st Street), formerly with the Shubert Organization.

June 16, A Crooked Man: Gabor Barabas, executive producer New Jersey Repertory; David Black, producer (George M!, A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To The Forum with Phil Silvers, The Aspern Papers, Ready When You Are C.B! with Julie Harris, The Impossible Years); Charles Johanson, executive director Grove Theater Center, LA; Lorca Peress, artistic director MultiStages (The Judas Tree, Day of Reckoning); Ricky L. Stevens, producer/general manager (Glory Days, A Catered Affair, Radio Golf); Eric Ting, associate artistic director Long Wharf Theatre; Cheryl Wiesenfeld (Legally Blonde, Caroline or Change, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels, The Exonerated, Elaine Stritch: At Liberty).

All performances at The Players Theater (mainstage),

115 MacDougal Street (south of west 3rd Street)

Series made possible with public funds from the New York State Council on the Arts (NYSCA), a stage agency; and from the NYC Department of Culutral Affairs (DCA) and the Friars National Foundation Association.

THE 2007 TRU VOICES

NEW PLAYS READING SERIES!

Ninth annual series of new plays by TRU writers produced by TRU producers, followed by reception and our "Dollars and Sense" panels on producing featuring prominent commercial producers, artistic directors and general managers. All performances will be at 7pm.

Monday 6/25:

The Ibsen Follies

by Skot Davis,

produced by RK Greene and

The StoryLine Project LLC.

Directed by Sonia Gluckman,

with Evan Buxbaum, Dan Diggles,

Heather Massie, Mort Milder,

Michelle Ramoni, Jackie Reinking,

Patrick Turner, Susan Wands

"Dollars and Sense" panel: Peter Bogyo, general manager with the Sprecher Organization (A Moon for the Misbegotten w/Kevin Spacey, Sly Fox w/Richard Dreyfus, Fortune’s Fool, Madame Melville, The Unexpected Man, The Joys of Sex); James Morgan, artistic director York Theatre Company; Janet Pailet, P2 Creations, producer (How the Grinch Stole Christmas, The Great American Trailer Park Musical); Michael Parva, artistic director The Directors Company; Jack Thomas, producer Bulldog Theatrical (Almost, Maine, No Way to Treat a Lady, Our Lady of 121st Street), formerly with the Shubert Organization; Orin Wolf, Off-Broadway Booking.

Ibsen is spinning in his grave!

Caught in a romantic farce - where two young lovers seek escape

from the gloom of Norwegian literary history -

Ibsen squares off against his arch rival Bjornson… and only the lovers win!

The Players Theater (mainstage; except To Barcelona! is in the Loft), 115 MacDougal Street (south of 3rd Street)

CLICK HERE for TRU Voices Plays and Musicals prior to 2004

Also visit our TRU Musicals web page
